entries.title: China Says It Has Taken U.S. Semiconductor Rules to WTO
entries.description: Beijing is challenging Washington’s export controls, considering them trade protectionism.

entries.title: Three Top VMware Executives to Leave
entries.description: The senior executives are leaving the enterprise software company that Broadcom wants to acquire for $61 billion, VMware’s leader told staff in a memo.

entries.title: Elon Musk's Twitter Takeover Draws NASA's Attention
entries.description: The space agency’s administrator says that SpaceX President Gwynne Shotwell said Twitter won’t distract from the company’s mission.

entries.title: Thoma Bravo to Take Coupa Software Private in $8 Billion Deal
entries.description: The cloud-based business-spend management platform said its shareholders will be paid $81 a share, which represents a 77% premium to Coupa’s closing price Nov. 22, the last full trading day before media reports of a potential takeover surfaced.

entries.title: Food-Delivery Apps Press to Amend New York City Fee Caps
entries.description: Grubhub and other services say current limits leave them feeling pinched. Restaurants fear price-gouging.

entries.title: Microsoft Takes Stake in London Stock Exchange
entries.description: The deal brings together one of the U.S.’s biggest tech companies with Europe’s biggest market exchange.

entries.title: China Halts Location Tracking App as Covid Restrictions Fall
entries.description: China is dismantling a symbol of one of the world’s sternest Covid-19 containment regimes: its nationwide mobile tracking app.

entries.title: Twitter's New Head of Trust and Safety Says Platform Wants to Move Quickly
entries.description: The social-media platform is emphasizing moving swiftly to address problematic content, even if it means figuring out some specifics later.

entries.title: EU Delays Labeling Lithium Toxic as Concerns From EV Industry Mount
entries.description: European battery makers say the EU needs to offer better incentives to compete with the U.S. Inflation Reduction Act.

entries.title: Sam Bankman-Fried's Parents Were There for FTX's Rise, and Now Its Fall
entries.description: Sam Bankman-Fried’s parents, both professors at Stanford Law, were there for FTX’s rise—and now its fall.

entries.title: Rivian Pauses Talks With Mercedes on Joint Van Factory in Europe
entries.description: The electric-vehicle maker said it wants to focus on its existing commercial-van business, as well as retail sales of trucks and SUVs.
